item.description:
It's that time of year again! Time for drinking like a lephrechaun! Don't forget to wear green or something St. Patrick's Day-ish (or whatever the heck you want!). By now, most people know what I look like, but I will be wearing my shamrock headband and a green Sox shirt.

Here's all the info:

-Kick off the St. Patrick's Day Holiday season in Harpoon style!
-What better place to begin the season than inside the largest brewery in Boston?!?!?!
-Food vendors selling Corned beef & cabbage along with other delicious food
-Cash bars offering a selection of fresh Harpoon and UFO beer featuring Celtic Ale
Featuring live Irish and Rock and Roll bands from the Boston area
-Come dance the jig, enjoy Harpoon beer, and celebrate St. Patrick!

When will it be?
-Friday: 5:30 PM to 11:00 PM (Doors close at 9:30 pm)

Where is it?
-At the Harpoon Brewery, 306 Northern Ave., Downtown Boston.
-Inside The Brewery amongst the tanks and outside under huge circus tents
-Free shuttles from the South Station area. Departs from behind the Federal Reserve along the -Fort Point Channel off Summer Street. Look for the Shuttle Sign.


More details:
-Cover charge $15.00 and includes a souvenir Pint Cup (does not include food or beer)
-Cash bars serving a selection of fresh Harpoon beer for $5.00 per 16 oz. cup

Check the website for the upcoming band schedule. Usually, Joshua Tree plays there and they're really good.

There's usually a coat check (a few $$) so you don't have to lug your coat, etc. around all night. Bathrooms are porta-potty's, so be prepared! Also, the food isn't THAT good, so eat something before hand or take a snack with you. There are a few food vendors inside south station if you want to grab something there.

**I recommend taking the T and leaving your car at home, especially if you're going to drink. The beer is stronger than normal, since it comes fresh from the brewery.**

We'll be meeting between 5 and 5:30 outside Clarke's. Then we'll head over using the shuttle. Please RSVP by 4pm on March 6th so we know who to look for at Clarke's. Maybe's will be considered a "No" at that point. Thanks! :)
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet outside of Clarke's at SOUTH STATION-NOT Faneuil Hall!!!!
item.name: Harpoon St. Patrick's Festival
